conversations.content: More! I demand MORE!
What are you shouting about, Xander?
This is a travesty!
I am Saint Starfall, yes? But despite graciously offering to deliver presents to the peasants on this most auspicious occasion, there is a dearth of said gifts!
How am I supposed to spread the blessings of Dragonyule now, I ask you?!
Actually, I think there's more to being Saint Starfall than delivering presents.
Pish-posh!
No, I'm serious. For example, you could look for people in need and offer them a helping hand.
That's something Saint Starfall would do.
Hmm. I suppose it IS a king's duty to provide charity to the various rabble. My thanks, Euden!
I shall set forth and aid this castle's inhabitants with all speed!
Hmm. What to cook tonig—
Lay down your ladle and mop your clammy brow, laborer!
What did you just call me? ...Also, what is all that food?
Why, this is my feast, of course! I know you to be a rather busy individual, so I did you the honor of cooking tonight.
You...did?
Ha HA! Allay your suspicions, good woman. If you are concerned about how it tastes, you merely need to try some yourself.
Well, if you insist... *munch* Oh my goodness. This is incredible.
Of course! When your regent is involved, nothing less than the best will do.
Think of it as a gift from the gallant Saint Starfall himself. I pray you and all my other vassals take great succor from it.
This is certainly an unexpected kindness. But if I may ask, where exactly did all of this food come from?
Where else but our larder? I used all that we had.
ALL of it?!
In truth, it made for a rather pitiful feast, but ah well! Still, you must excuse me, for there are others who even now cry out for Saint Starfall's aid. Farewell!
Ugh. Now I have to go shopping AGAIN.
Hah! Yaah! Haaaaaah!
*sigh* This is getting me nowhere. There must be a better way to train.
Consider your prayers answered, knave, for Saint Starfall is here to help!
Permit your king to show you a better way to increase your strength!
Oh? I cannot help but feel apprehensive about this—but very well.
Excelsior! Now close your eyes.
All right.
Hmm? My feet suddenly feel heavier. What have you done, Xander?
I attached some weights to your greaves. This is guaranteed to make your training much more productive.
Hnnngh! ...Yes, this does seem effective. You have my thanks, Xander.
Think nothing of it. Everyone else rejected them, so I am glad they were of use.
Really? They rejected them?
Alas, yes—but everything in this world has a use, and a great king knows how to find it! Ha HA! Ha HA ha ha ha ha!
...Whew! That was exhausting—but it DOES feel as though it was productive.
Let me just remove these weights and... What?! Oh, blast! They require a KEY!
How dreadfully inconvenient—I see now why everyone else refused them.
Er, Xander? ...Xander?! Where are you?! I need the key to these weights!
...Wait. He LOCKED weights on your legs?
Indeed—and now everyone can hear my clomping approach from miles away.
*sigh* I'm sorry, Elly. I think this is all because of what I said to him.
You have no need to apologize, Your Highness.
Indeed, I rather admire the fact that he is trying to bring happiness to others, even if he is somewhat...bad at it.
Xander just needs to be a little more considerate in how he goes about it.
Ah! A little birdie spoke my name!
Hello, Xander. We were just talking about how you've been helping people lately.
Ha HA! A fine topic of discussion indeed.
In fact, I was just thinking that I should expand the reach of my benevolence.
Why restrict myself to a castle when I can grant my blessings to the outside world?
What?!
Now THAT is a task fit for a king!
Er, this sounds like it will be a lot of work for one person. Maybe I should tag along.
How very considerate of you to offer! You really are my number-one vassal.
I shall take you up on your proposal so you might witness a true monarch in action.
Psst! Guys, if he seems like he's going to cause trouble, I'll do my best to stop him.
Best of luck, Your Highness.
This marked the beginning of Xander and Euden's long, eventful journe—
THE KEY! I forgot to ask him for it! Xander, waaaaait!
I see we have finally reached a village. Let the good work of Saint Starfall begin!
How exactly are you planning to go about this plan of yours?
Hmm... Well, we should start by finding some poor serf in need and hearing what they have to say.
That sounds like a plan, I suppose. ...Hmm? Who's that?
*sigh*
Ah! That lad has the dejected expression of one who cries out for Saint Starfall's blessed salvation!
Never fear, child, for I am here!
Who are you, mister?
Who am I? Why, I am none other than the reverent king himself, Saint Starfall! ...Also your most sacred monarch, Xander.
Wow, you're a lot of stuff!
This is the way of it when one stands astride the world. Now speak, for the worries of a ruler's people are his own.
Umm...
I don't blame you for being bewildered, but he's serious about trying to help. Is there anything you need?
Um, well, my dad won't celebrate Dragonyule with me.
He doesn't have time 'cause he's always trying to sell candles this time of year.
Then it falls to me to show him the error of his grievous ways!
You'd really do that, mister?!
Of course—for I am a man of his word. Euden, to me!
Xander, wait! We don't even know where his father IS!
Candles! Get'cher fresh hot candles here! Fine Dragonyule caaaandles for sale!
Blimey! Been here all day, and not a copper in me pocket to show for it. What am I gonna do?
You there! Chandler! I can see by your countenance that you are the father of the young lad I encountered earlier.
Cor! Who're you?!
Why, none other than the kingliest of kings! I am Saint Starfall—AND I am Xander!
Don't rightly follow none'a that.
We came after speaking with your son. He said you weren't able to go home for the holiday until you sold all your candles.
Aye, that's the way of it. If I don't sell me candles, I gots no money what to ring in the new year with.
But folks won't even give 'em a passin' glance, they won't! Fine candles, too...
This is a busy street—you'd think it would be a great place to set up shop.
Plus, everyone uses candles to celebrate Dragonyule. I'm honestly surprised you're having so much trouble selling them.
That's 'cause they all buy 'em from that blasted shop over there! Cor, but I'm useless, so I am...
Nonsense! You simply need to persuade the people to buy from you by touching their hearts.
How's that again?
Permit me to give you a demonstration. Oh, and you should pay close heed to this, Euden.
Touching the hearts of his people is important for a king, so you would do well to learn from a master.
Friends! Alberians! Countrymen! Lend me your ears!
AAAUUGH! You scared me!
What's this all about? I'm busy!
Oy, why'd he go all quiet-like there? Did he get cold feet what from all the folks watchin' him?
I think this is intentional—his silence is just making everyone more curious about what he's going to say next.
This is what he meant by touching hearts...
Have any of you ever witnessed true darkness? An inky black so deep that you cannot even see your own hand before your face?
I have. It happened when I was driven from my home and forced into the wilds— and I will never forget the memory.
Imagine it! Alone at night in a strange land, the howls of fiends in the distance... It is a horror beyond description!
*shudder*
Ah, but to deny one's fear and put on a brave face would be tantamount to suicide, for admitting fear is vital to a long life.
So what should one do, then? ...You there! I would have your answer!
What, me? Um...I don't know?
Ah! An excellent answer! To know and accept one's ignorance is at times equally vital if one wishes to see tomorrow.
Well then, I shall impart the answer: What you should all do is prepare for the possibility that you may one day find yourself in that selfsame situation.
One can never be too prepared when it comes to such matters.
That is why your king recommends these fine candles to you all! If you always keep one in reserve, you need not fear even the blackest ebon night.
Yeah, but I already bought a bunch of candles for Dragonyule.
Yet is danger not present all year 'round?
Would you truly squander your precious candle supply on merriment when the wolf is at your door? Do you neglect your own safety so?!
So I say to you, prudent men and women who are gathered here—grasp this candle of safety with your own two hands!
He's right! I'll take one!
I'll take three!
I'LL BUY ALL THE CANDLES!
Wow! He's selling out as we speak!
Xander's speech worked...
Now raise your candles high and cry to the heavens: ＂Safety is in my hands!＂
Safety is in my hands!
There now! That wasn't so difficult.
Yer a wizard, so ya are! A wizard, I say! Now I can spend the holiday ringin' in the new year with me family!
If you have time to be thanking me, you have time to get back to your son.
He really wants to celebrate Dragonyule with you.
I will!
...Huh. I guess that's that.
Ah, but our work has only begun.
Saint Starfall could never be satisfied with just helping ONE person! Ha HA!
Being Saint Starfall is more arduous than I thought. We should stop for lunch in this fine establishment.
That sounds like a plan. ...Hmm?
Oy! Seasoning's a bit strong today, ain't it?
T-terribly sorry about that, sir.
Guess we're eatin' for free today! Bwaaa ha ha ha!
Oh dear. This seems to be a gathering place for hoodlums.
What're you lookin' at, fancy-pants? You wanna fight?!
Oy, 'old on a sec. I'm thinkin' these two look right set in the pocketbook.
Right then, lads! Best 'and over everything ya got, or there's gonna be trouble, yeah?
You're either very conceited or terrifically stupid to be threatening me of all people.
What'd you just say?!
We're clearly not going to do as they say, Xander, but that still doesn't mean we should provoke them.
Looks like you two need a little lesson in proper manners!
Get 'em, boys!
Urk... G-gots carried away, we did...
Hmph. I knew you three were all bluster.
Sorry for all the broken furniture, ma'am.
Oh, don't you worry about those old things! Thank you very much for coming to my aid.
You three churls should feel ashamed for threatening such a polite woman.
All well and good for you to lecture us, Lord High-and-Mighty. We ain't gots no other way what to live!
No one'd even dream of giving us real work, so threatenin' and deceivin' folks is 'ow we put bread on the table.
So shut your mouth, pretty boy! You don't know nothin'.
So you think to insult me after being so soundly defeated, do you?
Then as Saint Starfall—and your king— I will give you three an extra special gift. Ah, I see you're practically quivering in delighted anticipation!
Well, here it is: I will show you all a hell befitting rotten scum like you!
But 'ell ain't no gift!
Oh yes it is! Now, the three of you are coming with me whether you like it or not. ...We're leaving, Euden.
Wait, Xander!
First: tree-felling hell! You're going to cut down trees until your arms break!
Then you will use that wood to make new tables and chairs to replace the ones that were destroyed. Now get to work!
Eeeeeeeek!
Next: cooking hell! YOU are going to practice cooking until you can make every item on this establishment's menu to perfection!
ALL of 'em?! Gyaaaaah!
Finally: forced-smiling hell! YOU are going to learn to smile in the face of any adversity!
Eeeeeek! ...Erm, I mean, 'allo? Tee hee? Smiiiiileeee?
Eventually, the many hells Xander inflicted upon the ruffians came to an end—and when they did...
Welcome, good sir! Might I ask the size of your party today?
Oh my! Such a polite greeting!
One grilled fish, comin' right up!
*munch* Wow! This tastes amazing!
These chairs are so comfortable, too. They must have been made by a very skilled carpenter.
Aw, you're makin' me blush...
I feel ravenous! Bring me the daily special, and pile that plate high!
I'll take another grilled fish, too!
C-coming right up!
I dunno what's goin' on here, but this actually seems to be...good?
Yeah, and everyone's smilin', too. Makin' people happy feels nice!
Sure beats havin' everyone loathe ya.
I don't get it. We've been nothin' but useless at real work up till now.
Right? One minute that rich bloke's makin' us suffer, and then...
Ah, but this was my plan all along.
That's incredible, Xander! You did an amazing job noticing their hidden talents.
Those who have given up on living simply stop noticing their own potential.
Take you, for example.
M-me?
You are highly dexterous—which I could tell by how you handled your weapon so much better than your friends.
So ya had me make the furniture!
And you were the one who told the owner the seasoning was strong, yes?
Y-yeah...
That means your tongue is capable of discerning even small changes in taste; it's common knowledge such people make excellent chefs.
I 'ad no idea...
That leaves the one who first tried to pick a fight with me.
M-me?
You have courage, which is something you need when serving customers you've never met...
But more than anything, you have a charming smile. I was certain people would warm to you instantly.
Oy, you're creepin' me out!
Still, uh...thanks for all this, yeah?
You are quite welcome! Just make sure to stay on the right path from now on.
Now let us go—there are still others who need my help! Ha HA!
Right. Let's keep up the good work!
There are an unusual number of couples walking about town today.
Do you think they're all out celebrating Dragonyule?
Perhaps. Regardless, they all seem to be enjoying themselves; I don't believe Saint Starfall's support is needed here.
Wait. Look at that man there.
*siiigh*
Ah, but he does appear to be in low spirits. My assistance is needed after all!
Ho there, plebeian! Tell Saint Starfall what is troubling you, that he might resolve it!
Heh, really? Thanks, but no one can help with this.
Ha HA! You could not be more wrong! Nothing is impossible for me!
Easy, Xander. ...Sir, if you don't mind talking to us, you'd probably feel better getting your worries off your chest.
Oh, I suppose you're right. In that case, the problem is with a girl I like.
She's come into my shop a few times, but she also happens to be the daughter of a wealthy noble.
But she's not haughty or arrogant at all! She always takes a moment to smile at me and pass the time with conversation.
A sure sign she cares for you! Do you not agree, Euden?
Aren't you maybe reading a bit too much into that actual—
Nonsense! The woman is clearly waiting for you to declare your undying love!
In which case, I shall create a situation where you might confess your feelings!
Er, but she's a noble. I can't just walk up to her and start a conversation.
Ha HA! You are speaking to a king, lad! No door is barred to me!
Halt! Who goes there? This is off-limits!
Mind your tongue, knave! You speak to Xander—and Saint Starfall besides!
Never heard of you.
Now see here! You must have spoken with many a noble in your lowly position as gatekeeper, yes? Surely you can tell that I have the aura of royalty!
Well, you're certainly arrogant enough.
Actually, he IS a king. ...And I'm a prince, if that makes any difference.
Well, this is JUST what I needed today. I'm probably going to get sacked no matter what I end up deciding...
I'm glad you finally understand. Then inside we shall go! Ha HA!
Whoa. He actually let us through.
It's too early to be celebrating, dear lad. The real ordeal is yet to come.
A-ha! Is that the object of your affections?
Th-that's her. Oh man, all of this is making my stomach hurt...
Have courage, young man, and go forth safe in the knowledge that we both are watching over you!
Gyaaa!
Hmm? Oh, hello! You work at that shop in the village, right?
That's right! Er, a-and I'm so happy that you remember me!
But the thing is... Well, you see, I really came here to tell you something...
Hmm? You there! Leave my daughter alone and depart from this place at once!
Please wait, Father. He says he came here to tell me something.
And what subject of worth could a commoner POSSIBLY have to discuss with nobles such as ourselves?
This is not a matter of class, sir!
Who the devil are you?!
This moment will determine the course of that young man's future; you must stand aside and let it unfold as it will.
Hmph! Now I see what is going on... and it is all the more reason he must leave at once!
No commoner has the right to confess their love to a noble. How absurd!
You are no more noble than he to the eyes of a king like myself!
Now be silent and let him speak!
Guh...
Go on, young man. Tell that woman the strength of your love for her!
Th-thank you!
See, the thing is, ever since I first met you, I've...
...Sorry it had to end like that.
I never expected she might refuse him! Still, this IS a positive outcome in its own way.
How could having his love rejected be a positive outcome?
He was able to see his resolve through to the end. The result is purely secondary.
I expect you feel the same way, young man?
Sort of, I guess. I mean, I'm sad she said no, but I DO feel a lot better now that it's out in the open.
So thank you. If you two hadn't come when you did, I'd have been agonizing over what to do forever.
So what matters is not having regrets? I see. That makes sense.
Indeed. I shall kick down the walls around the heart and liberate it. Thus is the sacred task and duty of Saint Starfall!
Stars are as beautiful when they fall as they are when they shine high in the sky. So go forth, young man, and turn the next page of your life!
Xander and the prince's eventful journey was finally reaching its end...
We should return to the castle soon.
But first, I have one more task to complete.
What's that?
You have served me well during this journey, and I intend to see you rewarded!
Merely name a thing that you desire, and your king will see it done.
I don't need anything. I'm just glad we were able to help so many people.
Humility may be a virtue, but there is no need for it here. Surely you must want for something?
Speak, vassal! Your king seeks to compensate you for your labor!
In that case, all I really want is for you to keep doing what you've been doing.
Explain this!
Just keep helping me. That's all I need.
Unacceptable! That is no reward!
Is there truly nothing you want from me, however small?
Look, I get where you're coming from, but I really can't think of anything.
Look there! It's the traitorous prince!
Uh oh! Imperial soldiers!
You're not getting away this time, criminal! We're taking you in!
Let's get out of here, Xander!
I beg your pardon? WHAT did you just call Euden?
A criminal. What of it?
No one calls my finest vassal a criminal! I'll not stand for it!
Prepare for punishment, curs!
Xander, don't!
Hraaaah!
Gaaaah!
Never speak ill of my vassals again! Do you hear me?!
Retreat! Retreeeeeat!
Thank you, Xander.
Heh. Think nothing of it.
Still, while they may have fled now, they'll likely return with numbers.
Then we should get back to the castle.
Hold a moment, Euden.
What is it?
I have something to say.
This has been an eventful journey indeed, but you stuck by my side during it all.
And all this time, I have been struggling to decide on a worthy gift for you—but I have finally thought of one.
It's nice of you to put so much thought into it, Xander. What did you decide?
Ha HA! Prepare to be astounded!
Your reward shall be...this entire land!
What?!
If you rule this land, no one will name you ＂criminal＂ again.
To date, I have simply been lending you my strength—but from now on, I shall rise up and make you the supreme ruler of all!
Our conquest is only just beginning!
I'm glad you're willing to do this for me, but ＂supreme ruler of all＂ seems like...overkill?
Not at all! You are more than capable of it; you should realize that potential.
This journey has allowed me to discover anew that so long as I am with you, no dream is out of reach!
Of course, supreme or not, I will still stand above you as the kingliest of kings! Ha HA! Ha HA ha ha ha ha!
Heh. That figures. Still, it's reassuring to hear you say all that.
Thanks, Xander. I'll be counting on you.
An excellent response, my vassal! You are not my finest for nothing.
Now let this continent be filled with our cries of Happy Dragonyule!
Our future is most bright indeed, Euden!
